page.title: 02RELIGION IN KEYINGHAM
page.content: The majority of practising Christians, (about 10% of the population), are Anglican or Methodist. There are two Anglican churches, St. Wilfrids at Ottringham, St. Nicholas at Keyingham, the resident minister living in Keyingham. There is a Methodisy chapel in both places, but no resident minister. Other religeous denominations - Roman Catholics, Quakers and Jehocahs Witnesses must travel outside the area to Withernsea of Hedon for worship. The majority of marriage and funeral services, regardless of whether the person practices their religion, are conducted in the local parish church, but baptism and confirmations are on the decline.
